When i was going to the moon i was thinking why bob and bill were in the cockpit driving they aren't pilots i then thought that there should be a new type of kerbal a docter 

he would not be able to drive but would be in a medical station and kerbals would go to it to be healed 

Yes i know you would have to code a completely new system but i think it would be cool

now this is where i need help guys ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) NO I MEANT THE PLAYERS NOT YOU KERBALS

anyway i need help on the way kerbals would be damaged 

i was thinking if they hit something to hard or if the cockpit heat got passed a safe point but i cant think of anything

high gravity could do it to

after i got a comment about it wouldent add much gameplay i kept thinking gameplay i then thought Sickness tell me about this idea but i got a idea

the way sickness would work would be your kerbal would get a sickness when a event comes for example solar radiation if you get to close to the kerbol/sun you might get it you would have to have a medical staff treat the kerbal

if you don't in time they die this could be used to stop people from doing things you dont like

Thank you for taking your time on reading my thread and Please Please tell me anything you would change/add ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)

check out my other post a display for your old ships

How about injury because of high G during launch or maneuvers?

Yeah, I'm always like "I jumped from really high up, how did his legs not break?" But I guess they aren't human and if a character damage system was implemented, it would be less kid-friendly. Also, I agree that more updates or DLC's should be about kerbals themselves.
